article.headline: Lehigh 79, St. Peter's 62
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. -- Zahir Carrington scored 21 points -- one of four Lehigh players who finished in double figures -- as the Engineers cruised to a 79-62 win over St. Peter's on Saturday. Marquis Hall added 20 points for Lehigh (1-0), while Phil Anderson had 12 points and Prentice Small finished with 11 points. Wesley Jenkins had a game-high 25 points for the Peacocks (0-1), while Ryan Bacon had 11 points. St. Peter's was in control early on, jumping out to a 18-11 lead, but Lehigh fought back and took the lead for good on Small's layup with 7:52 left in the first half and led 39-31 at the break. They then opened the second half with a 17-11 run and held double-digit leads for most of the half. Lehigh also won the battle of the boards, outrebounding the Peacocks 35-29.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
